para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:9px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:14px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.46; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: There are some limitations when using reference views. Since the reference is really only a wrapper around the actual view that will eventually be loaded, it cannot allow all of the aspects for the wrapped view to be edited. You'll find that references merely support a base set of aspects that are common to all views.
